Semilocalizations of the Integers
gap> SizeScreen([75,24]);;
This package implements residue class unions of the semilocalizations &ZZ;_{(\pi)} of the ring of integers. It also provides the underlying &GAP; implementation of these rings themselves.
Entering semilocalizations of the integers
The ring &ZZ;_{(\pi)} or the ring &ZZ;_{(p)}, respectively.
The returned ring has the property IsZ&uscore;pi. The set pi of noninvertible primes can be retrieved by the operation NoninvertiblePrimes. IsZ&uscore;pi
NoninvertiblePrimes
gap> R := Z_pi(2); Z_( 2 ) gap> S := Z_pi([2,5,7]); Z_( 2, 5, 7 )

There are methods for the operations in, Intersection, IsSubset, StandardAssociate, Gcd, Lcm, Factors and IsUnit available for semilocalizations of the integers. For the documentation of these operations, see the &GAP; reference manual. The standard associate of an element of a ring &ZZ;_{(\pi)} is defined by the product of the noninvertible prime factors of its numerator.
gap> 4/7 in R; 3/2 in R; true false gap> Intersection(R,Z_pi([3,11])); IsSubset(R,S); Z_( 2, 3, 11 ) true
gap> StandardAssociate(R,-6/7); 2 gap> Gcd(S,90/3,60/17,120/33); 10 gap> Lcm(S,90/3,60/17,120/33); 40 gap> Factors(R,840); [ 105, 2, 2, 2 ] gap> Factors(R,-2/3); [ -1/3, 2 ] gap> IsUnit(S,3/11); true
